set to prepare for return of Kat and Alfie|last=Sheridan|first=Emily|date=14 July 2010|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=14 July 2010}} Wallace and Richie were the first cast members signed by new executive producer [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a219138/bryan-kirkwood-executive-producer-eastenders.html|title=Bryan Kirkwood (Executive Producer, 'EastEnders')|last=Green|first=Kris|date=11 May 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=11 September 2010}} The decision was made following the resignation of [[Barbara Windsor]], who played [[Peggy Mitchell]], which left what Kirkwood described as a "hole" in the programme. Kirkwood decided that the time was right for Kat and Alfie to return, saying that they "very much herald the new era of ''EastEnders''."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a275070/enders-boss-teases-spectacular-fire-ep.html|title='Enders boss teases "spectacular" fire ep|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=9 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=11 September 2010}} The plot saw Alfie and Kat regaining control of [[The Queen Victoria]] public house after it burned down,{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a236699/kat-and-alfie-to-regain-the-vic-in-enders.html|title=Kat and Alfie to regain The Vic in 'Enders|last=Green|first=Kris|date=1 July 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=1 July 2010}} and Kat returning to Walford pregnant, with some public suspicions about the paternity of her child .{{cite web|url=http://www.atvnewsnetwork.co.uk/today/index.php/atv-today/3560-baby-moon-michael-kat |title=Mini-Moon for EastEnders Kat |last=Rank |first=Serge |date=11 August 2010 |work=[[ATV Today]] |publisher=[[Associated Television]] |accessdate=18 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111009153010/http://www.atvnewsnetwork.co.uk/today/index.php/atv-today/3560-baby-moon-michael-kat |archivedate=9 October 2011 }} To promote the characters' return, the BBC released a trailer across the BBC network in September 2010. The western-themed trailer sees Kat outside of The Queen Victoria, with various characters looking on and Kat saying "Where d'ya get a drink around 'ere?" with Alfie replying "I think you're gonna' need one." The advertisement uses the tag line "It's all kicking off in the square".{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8p4xlLezos0|publisher=[[YouTube]]/[[BBC]]|accessdate=16 September 2010|date=10 September 2010|title=Kat and Alfie Trailer – EastEnders – BBC One}} The return, in September 2010, drew 9.22 million viewers and 37.7% of the total TV viewing audience.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/news/a278076/soaps-ratings-roundup-september-20.html|title=Soaps Ratings Roundup: September 20|last=Millar|first=Paul|date=21 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=22 September 2010|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]}} Kat returned on 17 September 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00ts64p|title=17/09/2010|date=10 September 2010|publisher=[[BBC Programmes]]|accessdate=10 September 2010}} Wallace admitted she was nervous about reprising the role of Kat.{{cite web|last=Love|first=Ryan|title=Wallace admits 'EastEnders' return fear|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a305865/wallace-admits-eastenders-return-fear.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=25 February 2011}} Speaking to ''[[TVTimes]]'', Wallace said she'd feared she forgot how to play Kat. She commented: "I missed playing Kat," she said. "Now it feels like I've come home. I was nervous at first because I thought I might have forgotten how to play her, but as soon as I stepped back onto the Square she came back to me. Even when I was out of the show, people called me Kat every day in the street. I was flattered and now I'm having a great time. The recent scripts have been brilliant." Talking to ''[[What's on TV]]'', Wallace commented on Kat's reunion with Alfie. She said: "She punches him! Alfie has come looking for her and hasn't seen her for months. He keeps saying to her 'You're fat' and she says 'I'm not fat. I'm pregnant!' Then she says, 'Don't worry Alfie, it ain't yours'. She's peed off with him. He's been in prison and she's had to survive on her own pregnant. But she loves him unconditionally. No matter what they do, they will always end up together. She wants stability... a future for the baby and her. She sets him this challenge and he buys it."{{cite web|last=Millar|first=Paul|title=Jessie Wallace: 'Kat punches Alfie'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a277639/jessie-wallace-kat-punches-alfie.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=29 January 2012|date=19 September 2010}} ===Baby swap=== {{Quote box |width = 25em |border = 1px |align=right |fontsize = 85% |quote = "The storyline presented Ronnie with grief, disbelief and anger and the temporary breakdown of her relationship as well as her gradual coming to terms with her loss and the efforts to re-build her life following the tragedy. This underlined the fact to viewers that whilst the loss of baby James was a catalyst, Ronnie's reaction was born out of extreme personal trauma in her life and not as the direct and sole consequence of losing her baby. It is Ofcom's view that the broadcaster did not intend the storyline to suggest that her actions were a typical response of a mother who had experienced SIDS and therefore sufficient editorial context was provided to viewers." |salign = right |source =—Ofcom's broadcast bulletin clearing the storyline{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' cleared by Ofcom over baby swap plot|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a332665/eastenders-cleared-by-ofcom-over-baby-swap-plot.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=1 August 2011}} }} Richie revealed in an interview with ''[[This Morning (TV programme)|This Morning]]'' that Kat and Alfie would be involved in an ongoing storyline, which he said is "going to be the biggest soap story in probably the history of soaps."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a278381/shane-richie-teases-biggest-soap-story.html|title=Shane Richie teases 'biggest soap story'|last=Love|first=Ryan|date=23 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=23 September 2010}} At the end of 2010, Kat and Ronnie both give birth on the same day, but Ronnie's baby, James, dies and while Kat is in hospital and her baby, Tommy, is unattended, Ronnie swaps the infants. The storyline received over 6,000 complaints, making it the second most complained about ''EastEnders'' storyline. It was then decided to end the storyline earlier than originally planned.{{cite news|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Showbiz-News/EastEnders-Controversial-Baby-Swap-Storyline-Is-To-End-Earlier-Than-Planned/Article/201101115886107?f=rss |title=EastEnders' Baby Swap Plot To End Early |date=7 January 2011 |work=[[Sky News]] |publisher=[[Sky (UK & Ireland)|Sky TV]] |accessdate=16 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121014225002/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Showbiz-News/EastEnders-Controversial-Baby-Swap-Storyline-Is-To-End-Earlier-Than-Planned/Article/201101115886107?f=rss |archivedate=14 October 2012 }}{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=Confirmed: 'Enders baby plot to end early|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a296599/confirmed-enders-baby-plot-to-end-early.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=7 January 2011}} It was reported by the ''Daily Star Sunday'' that Ronnie experiences a change of heart after visiting relatives in hospital and seeing the midwife who delivered her son.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a305197/eastenders-cast-film-wedding-scenes.html|title='EastEnders' cast film wedding scenes|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=22 February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 March 2011|location=London}} An ''EastEnders'' spokesperson said, "We do not comment on future storylines but we have always said Ronnie will do the right thing and Tommy will be reunited with Kat."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a307350/eastenders-baby-swap-ending-revealed.html|title='EastEnders' baby swap ending revealed?|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=6 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 March 2011|location=London}} Wallace revealed that she doesn't regret her involvement of the baby-swap storyline, saying that she was "just doing her job".{{cite web|last=Kelly|first=Kristy|title=Jessie Wallace stands by 'Enders plot|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a300908/jessie-wallace-stands-by-enders-plot.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=28 January 2011}} Wallace told ''Bang Showbiz'':"I stand by it. We're actors at the end of the day, we do our job and then we go home. It's drama, that's it." She also praised Womack's acting and vowed to move on to "bigger and better things" after she departed. She added: "[Samantha is] a fantastic actress who played a brilliant role in a fantastic storyline so I wish her all the best." Derek Martin said he was surprised by the new baby swap storyline when it was published in the media.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=Enders actor: 'Baby plot surprised me|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a296612/enders-actor-baby-plot-surprised-me.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=7 January 2011}} Speaking on ''[[This Morning (TV programme)|This Morning]]'', Martin commented: "I'm one of those actors – I don't know how many others do it – but when I get the scripts, I only read my bits. So I looked [and saw], 'Charlie leaves his grandson upstairs, goes downstairs, gets on the drink, gets drunk – the baby's dead'. So that's terrible guilt obviously – because I feel as though it's my fault that he's died. I was surprised when I saw the story come out – because I don't read the others' [lines] – that it was a baby swap." Discussing the surrounding controversy of the plot, Martin added: "Don't forget, there's millions of people – there's 60 odd million here, and they've all got different opinions. Every subject, everything that comes up… everybody will have opinions about that. So therefore you have to accept that's the public – some are for, some are against, and that's the way it is." He continues: Over the years, don't forget, EastEnders have always had subjects. When [Charlie's] brother had raped Kat and we didn't find out until later on, that was a very strong storyline. And when Little Mo was bashed by her husband Trevor. These stories are all part of real life." [[File:Kat, Alfie and Tommy.jpg|250px|thumb|left|Kat and Alfie are finally reunited with Tommy. [[Nina Wadia]] defended the baby swap storyline and praised the acting skills from Wallace and Womack. [[Patsy Palmer]] also congratulated the plot for the "great acting".]] [[Nina Wadia]] has praised Womack and Wallace for their "acting skills" during the storyline.{{cite web|last=Daniels|first=Colin|title=Wadia praises "amazing" Womack, Wallace|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a300947/wadia-praises-amazing-womack-wallace.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=29 January 2011}} Wadia told ''The Sun'': "Sam and Jessie were amazing and it all got taken away from them because people made it out like a real baby had died. It's a soap. It's portraying fictional characters!" Marc Elliott added: "The storyline got whipped up into a massive frenzy. It's not representative in any way, shape or form of mothers who have lost their babies." ''EastEnders'' actress [[Patsy Palmer]] has also praised the plot for its "great acting".{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=Patsy Palmer defends 'EastEnders' baby plot|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a312667/patsy-palmer-defends-eastenders-baby-plot.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=4 April 2011}} In an interview with ''[[Take It Easy]]'', asked whether the show's bosses handled the storyline well, Palmer replied: "I think they did. I know there's been loads of bad press, but something like that is always going to be sad to watch and it will upset people. But at the end of the day, it's a drama and it's not real. I think it got blown out of all proportion. Unfortunately, things like that do happen in real life. Babies get swapped and snatched in hospitals. I'm sure that any parent who has lost a child will find even talking about their experience very difficult, let alone watching it being acted out on television. Even my daughter got upset but she is only 9 so maybe I shouldn't have let her watch it. I just didn't realise it was going to be so heart-wrenching, which was down to the great acting." Samantha Womack admitted that she thought the plot was "implausible".{{cite web|last=Sperling|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' baby-swap plot was implausible, says Samantha Womack|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a361391/eastenders-baby-swap-plot-was-implausible-says-samantha-womack.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=21 January 2012}} She commented: "I thought it was implausible. Most women who lose a child would not go out and abduct one," she told the ''[[Daily Mirror]]''. "But Ronnie is a soap character and she is not necessarily representing real life. Soap is based on controversy and sensationalism because bosses are trying to get high ratings and they can't write things like 'Ronnie had a cup of tea'. Otherwise people wouldn't watch it." On 1 August 2011, Ofcom cleared the storyline. The baby swap storyline prompted a huge 1,044 complaints reported to Ofcom. Ofcom also added that many of the complaints were made because the storyline was presented "in an offensive manner" because it "appeared to suggest that a mother who has suddenly and tragically lost a baby through cot death would react by stealing another baby to replace that loss". [[Kym Marsh]] supported Ofcom's decision to clear the storyline.{{cite web|last=Eames|first=Tom|title='EastEnders' baby swap Ofcom decision correct, says Kym Marsh|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a333992/eastenders-baby-swap-ofcom-decision-correct-says-kym-marsh.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=9 August 2011}} Marsh wrote in her magazine section: "Last week, EastEnders was cleared of wrongdoing by Ofcom, the media regulator, over its baby swap storyline, and I think that's the right decision. It's just a storyline, like any other. I understand why people got upset about it, but no-one meant to upset anybody. Soaps are supposed to portray real life to a certain extent, but it's meant to be high drama for entertainment purposes. I mean, how many murders can you have in one square? There's a nod to real life but, for the most part, soaps help take people out of the real world." Wallace previously stated that filming the baby swap storylines "did not stretch her acting abilities".{{cite web|last=Millar|first=Paul|title=Jessie Wallace: 'Enders baby plot not hard'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a314914/jessie-wallace-enders-baby-plot-not-hard.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=16 April 2011}} She told ''Buzz'': "None of it's been really tough for me, to tell you the truth. I go in, do my scenes and then I go home. As an actress you want to get roles you can get your teeth into. I leave it at the gates when I leave work. Years ago, with the storyline when Kat told Zoe Slater she was her real mother, I found it tougher because I was new to the game. But I've been doing it a lot longer now, and can detach myself from it. You have to." On a lighter note, Wallace added: "There are two babies playing Tommy, called Ralph and Shane, and they're dressed in outfits like zebra-skin babygros and little denim jackets – that's the Alfie (Shane Richie) influence. They keep going for Kat's big earrings and they're always grabbing at the chicken fillets I have to wear." {{cquote|It's so lovely having the chance to work with a baby all the time. It's made me really broody. But it's definitely not going to be easy for Kat and Alfie. They've grieved for the death of their child. They thought they'd buried him, and now they've suddenly got him back. That's a massive thing to deal with.|4=Jessie Wallace explains Kat's emotions after receiving Tommy.}} In an interview with ''Buzz'', Richie said that although that Kat and Alfie have received Tommy back, the couple still have problems to face.{{cite web|last=Kelly|first=Kristy|title=Shane Richie: 'Hard times await Kat and Alfie'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a315899/shane-richie-hard-times-await-kat-and-alfie.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=29 January 2012|date=21 April 2011}} He commented: "Kat and Alfie are happy to have Tommy back, but they still buried the baby they thought was their son. That destroyed them and their relationship. The cot-death storyline is just the start of what's going to happen to Kat and Alfie. I've also heard rumours about whether Alfie is really firing blanks. He had a fertility test in Spain. Could it be wrong?" Wallace and Richie have hinted that the plot could have a long lasting impact on Kat and Alfie.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' duo discuss baby plot climax|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a311688/eastenders-duo-discuss-baby-plot-climax.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=19 February 2012|date=29 March 2011}} Shane Richie added: "While Alfie happily throws himself into being a dad to Tommy, it's Kat who's going to be finding things difficult." ===Miscarriage=== Shortly after Kat is reunited with her baby, it was announced that Kat would fall pregnant by Alfie, despite Alfie believing he is infertile.{{cite web|last=Daniels|first=Colin|title=EastEnders' Kat Moon 'to face new baby tragedy|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a330254/eastenders-kat-moon-to-face-new-baby-tragedy.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=17 July 2011}} Shortly after finding out she is pregnant, Kat falls ill and is rushed to hospital and discovers that she has suffered a miscarriage. The ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' reports: "The pregnancy takes Kat and Alfie completely by surprise and neither of them know how they really feel about it," a source said. "Kat is understandably very nervous and anxious about having another baby. Her head is all over the place. But before she has a chance to get used to the idea she suffers a miscarriage. It is a cruel thing to happen to them after everything that they've already been through this year. And once again viewers will be in tears as they watch Kat come to terms with losing her baby." An ''EastEnders'' spokesperson added: "There is a little bit more heartache for Kat and Alfie as they try to rebuild their lives with Tommy." An additional ''EastEnders'' insider also commented: "The fact that Kat gets pregnant at all is amazing. Alfie has believed that he was infertile after trying to have kids with his wife for ages with no luck. So when Kat finds out that she's expecting, it's devastating not least because it raises some big questions in Alfie's mind."{{cite web|title=Kat Moon to have miscarriage |url=http://entertainment.stv.tv/tv/264088-kat-moon-to-have-miscarriage/ |publisher=[[STV (TV network)|STV]] |accessdate=29 January 2012 |date=28 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211030324/http://entertainment.stv.tv/tv/264088-kat-moon-to-have-miscarriage/ |archivedate=11 December 2013 }} The insider added to ''Inside Soap'': "Who can blame Alfie for asking some questions here? He stood by Kat while she had his cousin's baby and through the misery of losing baby Tommy. It would be absolutely devastating for him to learn that all this tragedy has driven them apart again." ''[[STV (TV network)|STV]]'' added that after forgiving Kat for cheating on him with Michael, Alfie would find it hard to get over another betrayal. ===Mark Garland=== [[File:Chris Simmons.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Chris Simmons (''pictured'') was cast as Mark Garland, a love interest for Kat.]]In 2011, Kat has a one-night stand with [[Mark Garland]] as Alfie is showing no interest in her.{{cite news|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/877749-eastenders-kat-moon-tempted-to-cheat-on-alfie-with-new-character-mark|title=EastEnders' Kat Moon tempted to cheat on Alfie with new character Mark|date=6 October 2011|work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=9 October 2011|location=London}} An insider said: "The trouble is that while Alfie is busy playing that game, a delivery driver who calls at the Queen Vic makes a big play for Kat – and soon she's facing serious temptation." The insider added: "Kat is vulnerable, insecure and at odds with Alfie. It's exactly the sort of state that could see her do something very stupid indeed. Alfie has done serious damage to their marriage but Kat could destroy it completely." Another source added: "In accusing her of cheating on him, Alfie has undone years of good work in building up Kat's self-esteem. No matter what he says now, she feels as though he still sees her as a woman of loose morals. He cooks up a hare-brained plan to keep Kat by treating her mean – and starts ignoring her, basically." In an interview with ''[[All About Soap]]'' Richie revealed how Alfie reacts. He commented: "It's the last thing he expected to hear. He didn't see it coming. He's upset and angry, especially when Kat tries to explain how he made her feel when he accused her of sleeping with someone else when she got pregnant again. He obviously didn't mean the things he said then – he just said them in the heat of the moment, but those words have stuck with Kat."{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' star Shane Richie teases Kat confession drama|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a350201/eastenders-star-shane-richie-teases-kat-confession-drama.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=10 November 2011}} Asked whether Alfie appreciates Kat's honesty, he replied: "Not at all – he'd rather not know. Deep down, Alfie knows that Kat has done things in the past that maybe she shouldn't have, but he didn't know all the details. Now he knows Kat has been unfaithful, he has got to confront the fact. The jury is still out on that one," he explained. "I don't know, if I'm honest. They always seem to take two steps forward and then one step back... They do tend to come through these things, so who knows?" ===Temporary break (2012)=== Kat was written out of ''EastEnders'' temporarily in January 2012.{{cite web|last=Daniels|first=Colin|title=Jessie Wallace 'written out of EastEnders for three months'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a362603/jessie-wallace-written-out-of-eastenders-for-three-months.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=28 January 2012}} The writers for ''EastEnders'' organised "emergency script changes" which saw Kat called away to care for her father Charlie after a stroke. A source said: "It was a very easy decision to make for the show. She is a great actress and extremely popular on set. She'll come back stronger than ever."{{cite web|last=White|first=Richard|title=Jessie Wallace is written out of EastEnders|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/4093634/Jessie-Wallace-is-written-out-of-EastEnders.html|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|accessdate=28 January 2012|date=28 January 2012}} It was announced shortly after Wallace's break from ''EastEnders'' that [[Sharon Watts]], played by [[Letitia Dean]], would return to the series.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders': Letitia Dean to reprise role as Sharon Watts|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a363385/eastenders-letitia-dean-to-reprise-role-as-sharon-watts.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=7 February 2012|date=2 February 2012}} Numerous tabloids reported that the purpose of Dean's return is to replace Jessie Wallace or to "fill the hole left behind by Wallace".{{cite web|last=Holmwood|first=Leigh|title=Shazza to avva Enders job back|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/article4103139.ece|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|accessdate=7 February 2012|date=2 February 2012}} This was later denied by an ''EastEnders'' spokesperson.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' Letitia Dean 'not replacing' Jessie Wallace|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a363538/eastenders-letitia-dean-not-replacing-jessie-wallace.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=7 February 2012|date=2 February 2012}} The spokesperson commented: "There is no link between Letitia's return to EastEnders and Jessie not being around at the moment. We have been working on plans to bring Sharon back for quite some time." An insider added: "Jessie and Letitia are two fantastic actresses and their characters are firm favourites with fans. Viewers can look forward to seeing them back on screen together later this year." Kat returned to the show on 7 June 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a382164/eastenders-kats-return-date-confirmed-more-schedule-changes.html |title='EastEnders': Kat's return date confirmed, more schedule changes – EastEnders News – Soaps |work=Digital Spy |date=17 May 2012 |accessdate=2012-11-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/showbiz/television-news/2012/04/15/jessie-wallace-returns-to-eastenders-after-three-month-break-86908-23825139/|title=Jessie Wallace returns to EastEnders after three-month break – The Daily Record|last=Payne|first=Will|date=15 April 2012|work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]|accessdate=15 April 2012}} Wallace praised ''EastEnders'' writers for bringing back Kat's funny and feisty attitude.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=EastEnders' Jessie Wallace: 'Kat returns fighting fit|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a385161/eastenders-jessie-wallace-kat-returns-fighting-fit.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=3 June 2012|date=3 June 2012}} Wallace added that it's like going home to her family and that she has missed Shane Richie. Wallace further explained: "Before [my] break, I had the baby swap story and towards the end of last year, Kat was becoming very downtrodden. Now she's coming back fighting fit. It's almost like when Kat first arrived on screen in 2000. She's come back with those original feisty, tarty, funny and a bit cold sides to her. It's a new Kat." ===Affair=== {{Main|Who's Been Sleeping with Kat?}} In June 2012, it was announced that Kat would embark on a long-running affair with another Albert Square resident after becoming bored with the lack of attention at home.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/eastenders/2012/06/is-kat-over-the-moon.shtml|title=Is Kat over the Moon?|date=6 June 2012|work=EastEnders|publisher=BBC|accessdate=7 June 2012|location=London}} The identity of her lover was kept secret from both the cast and the crew; all scenes of Kat with her lover were filmed with an extra. Speaking of the storyline, Executive Producer [[Lorraine Newman]] said: "The consequences are not only great for Kat and Alfie, but also for each individual suspect. The audience will join the cast and crew guessing across the summer and autumn as we eliminate the suspects one at a time, leading to one almighty explosion." After the storyline was announced, five suspects were revealed as potential candidates: [[Ray Dixon]] ([[Chucky Venn]]), [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]), [[Max Branning]] ([[Jake Wood]]), [[Derek Branning]] ([[Jamie Foreman]]) and [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]). In a poll on the website ''[[Digital Spy]]'', [[Jack Branning]] was shown to be the favourite with 43.5% of the votes.{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' fans expect Kat, Jack affair|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a385876/eastenders-fans-expect-kat-jack-affair.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=7 June 2012|date=7 June 2012}} Ray was eliminated when he walked in on Kat while she was on the phone to her lover. Michael was eliminated when Kat confessed to him that she was having an affair. With only the three Branning brothers left as suspects, it was revealed on 20 December that Kat's mystery lover was Derek.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a397991/eastenders-ray-dixon-ruled-out-from-kat-moon-affair-mystery.html|title='EastEnders': Ray Dixon ruled out from Kat Moon affair mystery|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=7 August 2012|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=8 August 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a406085/eastenders-michael-moon-eliminated-from-kats-affair-mystery.html|title='EastEnders': Michael Moon eliminated from Kat's affair mystery|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=14 September 2012|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=16 September 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a446643/eastenders-reveals-kats-mystery-lover.html|title='EastEnders' reveals Kat's mystery lover|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=20 December 2012|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=21 December 2012}} ===Departure (2016) and ''Kat & Alfie: Redwater''=== On 4 April 2015, the BBC announced that Wallace would appear in a six-part BBC One drama series alongside Richie and would also be departing ''EastEnders''. In the series, Kat and Alfie visit Ireland in the "search for answers to some very big questions". Speaking about the show, Wallace commented: "I have always loved working on ''EastEnders'' so when I heard of this new drama to take Kat and Alfie outside of Walford, I couldn’t believe our luck. To be exploring the next chapter for Kat as well as working alongside my best mate, Shane, is a dream come true and a huge compliment." The series, ''[[Kat & Alfie: Redwater]]'' began airing in May 2017. ''Kat and Alfie: Redwater'' follows Kat and her husband Alfie as they arrive in the fictional Irish village of Redwater to "search for answers to some very big questions" and put their past behind them.{{cite news|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2015-04-04/eastenders-kat-and-alfie-to-get-their-own-drama-series-on-bbc1|title=EastEnders: Kat and Alfie to get their own drama series on BBC1|last=Brown|first=David|date=4 April 2015|work=[[Radio Times]]|accessdate=25 April 2015}} Treadwell-Collins confirmed that "the discovery that Kat has a secret son will [...] ultimately lead to the Moons realising that the answers to so many questions lie across the sea in Ireland."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/eastenders/news/a674159/eastenders-spoilers-kat-and-alfie-moon-will-return-to-walford-this-christmas/|title=EastEnders spoilers: Kat and Alfie Moon will return to Walford this Christmas|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=17 October 2015|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}} Director [[Jesper W. Nielsen]] said the series is "About how one woman's search for a lost child opens Pandora's box; revealing the terrible lies and secrets in the little village of Redwater".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/eastenders/news/a790250/eastenders-spinoff-redwater-reveals-all-irish-cast/|title=EastEnders spinoff Redwater reveals its full cast as Kat and Alfie Moon head to Ireland|last=Harp|first=Justin|date=12 April 2016|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=12 April 2016}} Writer [[Matthew Graham]] said, "Kathleen Moon is an unwitting bomb in ''Redwater'' and creating the debris from her explosive arrival is what drew me to this project." He also said: "Everything [Kathleen] does comes out of the fact she doesn't think much of herself. So, her humour and her in-your-face qualities all come out of a place of insecurity. She doesn't think she's good enough. That's what I use when I'm writing Kat."{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/writersroom/entries/bfa918a6-91da-44c7-af9a-76b3e166e1d0|title=Matthew Graham Interview: Part One|last=Collinson|first=Gavin|date=27 April 2016|work=BBC Writersroom|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 April 2016}} Wallace was given a makeover for her part in ''Redwater'', different to how Kat looks in ''EastEnders''.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/eastenders/news/a790072/eastenders-star-jessie-wallace-has-had-a-makeover-for-spinoff-show-redwater/|title=EastEnders star Jessie Wallace has had a makeover for spinoff show Redwater|last=Sandwell|first=Ian|date=10 April 2016|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 April 2016}} Wallace explained that Kat's different look is because she has "mellowed" since leaving Walford and travelling to Spain, which she described as a "softer side to Kat than we've seen before", but said she still has a "fiery side to her, just not as much as we've seen in ''EastEnders''.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/611968/Jessie-Wallace-risked-life-in-EastEnders-spin-off-Redwater|title=Jessie Wallace RISKED her own life in new Eastenders spin-off series Redwater|last=Hill|first=Susan|date=7 May 2017|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|accessdate=7 May 2017}} Wallace described Kat as a "colourful person" with "a lot of layers to her" and said that after playing her for 16 years "means there's plenty underneath to bring to the surface." She said that Kat wants "peace and to settle down with no more drama in her life." In the series, the character is called "Kathleen" by all characters except Alfie, who calls her "Kat".{{cite interview |last1=Flanagan |first1=Fionnula |subject-link1=Fionnula Flanagan |last2=Richie |first2=Shane |subject-link2=Shane Richie |interviewer= |title=Welcome to the 2016 Irish Post Awards coming to you live from the Great Room at the Grosvenor House hotel on London’s Park Lane |type=video |url=https://www.facebook.com/TheIrishPost/videos/10155463547883452/ |work=[[The Irish Post]] |at=37–44 minutes |location= |date=25 November 2016 |access-date=26 November 2016}} ===Reintroduction (2018)=== On 20 December 2017, it was announced Jessie Wallace would reprise her role as Kat in Spring 2018. Her return was masterminded by interim producer John Yorke, who created the Slaters in 2000, and Kat will return alongside her grandmother [[Mo Harris]] ([[Laila Morse]]), and [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]). Yorke commented: "The Slaters are one of the all-time great families in ''EastEnders'' and Albert Square has never felt quite the same since they scattered to different ends of the country, and in some cases beyond. It has been a real joy to find a way to bring them back together and we’re incredibly excited about where we are taking them next. It won’t just be familiar Slaters either as there are a couple of twists and characters to add fresh spice to an iconic creation."{{cite news|last1=Harp|first1=Justin|title=EastEnders is bringing back Jessie Wallace as Kat Slater|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/eastenders/news/a845897/eastenders-bringing-back-jessie-wallace-as-kat-slater-big-mo-jean-slater-returning-too/|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 December 2017}} Wallace added: "I am thrilled to be returning to ''EastEnders'' next year and knowing what John Yorke has in store for the Slaters is incredibly exciting. I love Kat and Walford dearly and I cannot wait to get started – watch out Walford, Kat’s coming home."{{Cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/12/20/eastenders-spoilers-jessie-wallace-speaks-out-as-soap-confirms-kat-moon-return-7173503/|title=Alfie Moon dead as EastEnders confirms Kat, Mo and Jean Slater returns?|date=20 December 2017|work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|accessdate=21 December 2017}} Wallace praised Yorke for returning to family orientated drama and for revitalising the Slaters, a family he introduced, stating that there is "hustle and bustle" within the family.{{cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2018/03/16/eastenders-spoilers-romance-and-war-with-karen-taylor-jessie-wallace-reveals-whats-ahead-for-kat-7353292/|title=EastEnders spoilers: Romance and war with Karen Taylor? Jessie Wallace reveals what’s ahead for Kat|work=Metro|last=Lindsay|first=Duncan|date=16 March 2018|accessdate=17 March 2018}} Wallace explained that upon her return, Kat has "got debris to clear up, all the damage" caused by the news of her death imparted by Mo, but her "fun side" has returned, but wants Kat to remain single. With regard to other interactions, Kat could "clash" with [[Karen Taylor (EastEnders)|Karen Taylor]] ([[Lorraine Stanley]]), matriarch of the newly established Taylor family. ==Reception== Wallace has won multiple awards for her portrayal of Kat. At the [[National Television Awards]], she was named "Most Popular Newcomer" in 2001 and "Most Popular Actress" in 2003.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/tv_and_radio/2127719.stm|title=National TV Awards snub This Morning|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=14 July 2002|accessdate=28 March 2009}}{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/tv_and_radio/3222431.stm|title=EastEnders dominates awards|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=28 October 2003|accessdate=28 March 2009}} She also received "Most Popular Actress" nominations in 2002, 2004 and 2005.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/newsid_4370000/newsid_4374300/4374318.stm|title=Dr Who up for hat-trick of awards |work=[[Newsround]]|publisher=BBC|date=25 October 2005|accessdate=28 March 2009}} At [[The British Soap Awards]], Wallace won "Best Newcomer" in 2001.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/low/entertainment/1353527.stm|title=EastEnders triumph at UK soap awards|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=26 May 2001|accessdate=27 March 2009}} The following year, ''EastEnders'' won "Best Single Episode" for the episode in which Zoe learns Kat is her mother.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/low/entertainment/tv_and_radio/1996051.stm|title=EastEnders sweeps soap awards|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=19 May 2002|accessdate=27 March 2009}} Wallace was additionally nominated for the "Best Actress", "Best Dramatic Performance" and "Hero of the Year" awards in 2002, and Zoe's maternity was nominated "Best Storyline". She was again nominated "Best Actress" from 2003 to 2006 consecutively, and shared "Best On-Screen Partnership" and "Best Exit" nominations with Richie in 2004 and 2006 respectively.{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080202094430/http://www.thecustard.tv/linksandlists/soapawards.html|url=http://www.thecustard.tv/linksandlists/soapawards.html|archivedate=2 February 2008|title=British Television Soap Awards|publisher=thecustard.tv|accessdate=20 April 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://imdb.com/title/tt0088512/awards|title=Awards for "EastEnders"|publisher=[[Internet Movie Database]]|accessdate=27 March 2009}} She was further nominated in 2011 for 'Best Actress'.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/scoop/a307476/british-soap-awards-2011-voting-opens.html|title=British Soap Awards 2011 voting opens|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=7 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 March 2011|location=London}} The [[Inside Soap Awards|''Inside Soap'' Awards]] named Wallace "Best Newcomer" in 2001, Zoe's maternity "Best Storyline" in 2002, and Kat and Alfie "Best Couple" in 2004.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/tv_and_radio/1573380.stm|title=EastEnders triumph at soap awards|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=2 October 2001|accessdate=27 March 2009}}{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/low/entertainment/2289106.stm|title=Awards success for EastEnders|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=30 September 2002|accessdate=27 March 2009}}{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/nolpda/ukfs_news/hi/newsid_3694000/3694422.stm|title=EastEnders takes narrow soap win|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=28 September 2004|accessdate=27 March 2009}} A 2009 poll by ''[[Inside Soap]]'' magazine named Kat as the UK's favourite drama queen in a soap opera.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/news/a161496/soaps-greatest-lineup-revealed.html|title='Soap's Greatest' lineup revealed|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=23 June 2009|accessdate=18 July 2009}} Wallace was named "Best Soap Actress" at the 2003 ''[[TV Quick]]'' Awards.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/tv_film/newsid_3091000/3091876.stm|title=EastEnders cleans up at TV Quick Awards |work=[[Newsround]]|publisher=BBC|date=9 September 2003|accessdate=28 March 2009}} Following Kat's suicide attempt, Wallace received the 2002 Mental Health Media Award in the "Soaps and Continual Drama" category.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/2340373.stm|title=EastEnder wins mental health award|publisher=BBC|work=[[BBC News]]|date=18 October 2002|accessdate=27 March 2009}} The character's 2018 return storyline was nominated for "Most Bizarre Soap Storyline" at the 2018 ''[[Digital Spy]]'' Reader Awards.{{cite news |last1=Robinson |first1=Abby |title=The Digital Spy Reader Awards 2018: Vote now for your Soap favourites of the year! |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/feature/a871228/best-soap-2018/ |accessdate=1 December 2018 |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]] |date=29 November 2018}} A 2010 poll by ''Just Eat'' to find the "most desired dinner companions" from ''EastEnders'' put Kat in second place.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a203723/alfie-moon-voted-walfords-most-loved.html|title=Alfie Moon voted Walford's 'most loved'|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=17 February 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=15 October 2010}} After the announcement of Jessie Wallace playing the role of Kat, Steve Hendry from the ''[[Sunday Mail (Scotland)|Sunday Mail]]'' referred to Kat as a "stunner". In February 2011, following Kat's return to ''EastEnders'', Wallace was nominated for Best Actress at the 2011 All About Soap Bubble Awards for her portrayal of Kat, and was also nominated alongside Richie for Best Comeback.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/scoop/a303447/in-full-all-about-soap-bubble-nominations.html|title=In Full: All About Soap Bubble nominations|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=13 February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=14 February 2011|location=London}} She won the [[Television and Radio Industries Club|Television and Radio Industries Club (TRIC) Award]] for "TV Soap Personality" in March 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.tric.org.uk/main/2011winners.html |title=2011 TRIC Award Winners |publisher=The Television and Radio Industries Club |accessdate=8 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110312103936/http://www.tric.org.uk/main/2011winners.html |archivedate=12 March 2011 }} Also in February, the scenes revealing Kat as Zoe's mother has become "one of the most iconic moments in the history of EastEnders".{{cite news|last=Green|first=Kris|title='EastEnders' Moments: "You Ain't My Muvva!"|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a201011/eastenders-moments-you-aint-my-muvva.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=29 January 2012|date=15 February 2011}} In September 2011, Kat and Andy's wedding was voted as a "wedding from hell" by ''[[Yahoo!]]''.{{cite web|last=Horsley |first=John |title=Soap weddings from hell |url=http://uk.tv.yahoo.com/soap-weddings-from-hell.html |work=[[Yahoo! TV]] |accessdate=29 January 2012 |date=28 September 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120331160829/http://uk.tv.yahoo.com/soap-weddings-from-hell.html |archivedate=31 March 2012 }} After the announcement that Kat is to have a miscarriage, Tony Stewart from the ''Daily Mirror'' said that after the baby swap storyline, this is perhaps "too much agony for Kat to bear".{{cite news|last=Stewart|first=Tony|title=EastEnders: Tragedy for Kat Moon as she suffers miscarriage|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/tv/soap-news/2011/09/03/eastenders-tragedy-for-kat-moon-as-she-suffers-miscarriage-115875-23393373/|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|accessdate=29 January 2012|date=3 September 2011}} An ''EastEnders'' source added that "It is a cruel thing to happen to them after everything that they've already been through this year".{{cite news|last=Hill|first=Susan|title=New EastEnders baby agony for tragic Kat Moon|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/posts/view/201446|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|accessdate=29 January 2012|date=17 July 2011}} Laura-Jayne Tyler of ''[[Inside Soap]]'' enjoyed Kat's 2018 reintroduction and said that Wallace returned "on full gas, giving nothing less than her trademark powerhouse performances".{{cite journal|last1=Tyler|first1=Laura-Jayne|title=Hits & Misses|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=31 March - 6 April 2018|volume=2018|issue=13|page=98}} She felt that Kat's return gave the show "the vital spark [it has] been missing." She added, "You can take the girl out of Walford, but you'll never take Walford out of the girl..." ==See also== *[[List of Kat & Alfie: Redwater characters|List of ''Kat & Alfie: Redwater'' characters]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{EEcharlink|kat-moon}} *{{BBC Online|id=archives/communicate/archive/jessie_wallace/page1.shtml|title=Ask Jessie Wallace transcript}} {{EastEnders characters|present}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Slater, Kat}} [[Category:EastEnders characters]] [[Category:Fictional sexual assault victims]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 2000]] [[Category:Fictional bartenders]] [[Category:Fictional market stallholders]] [[Category:Fictional victims of child abuse]] [[Category:Fictional characters involved in incest]] [[Category:Fictional attempted suicides]] [[Category:Fictional characters with disfigurements]] [[Category:Fictional prostitutes]] [[Category:Female characters in television]]

revision.text:
{{One source|date=April 2015}}{{Infobox philosopher | name = Keiji Nishitani | image = Nisitani keiji.jpg | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1900|2|27}} | birth_place = | death_date = {{Death date and age|1990|11|24|1900|2|27}} | death_place = | nationality = | era = [[Contemporary philosophy]] | region = [[Japanese philosophy]] | religion = | school_tradition = [[Kyoto School]] | main_interests = | notable_ideas = | influences = [[Kitaro Nishida]]{{·}}[[Friedrich Nietzsche]]{{·}}[[Martin Heidegger]] | influenced = }} {{nihongo|'''Keiji Nishitani'''|西谷 啓治|Nishitani Keiji|February 27, 1900 – November 24, 1990}} was a [[Japan]]ese [[philosophy|philosopher]] of the [[Kyoto School]] and a disciple of [[Kitarō Nishida]]. In 1924 Nishitani received a Ph.D. from Kyoto University for his dissertation ''"Das Ideale und das Reale bei Schelling und Bergson"''. He studied under [[Martin Heidegger]] in Freiburg from 1937-9. ==Career== He held the principal Chair of Philosophy and Religion at [[Kyoto University]] from 1943 until becoming [[emeritus]] in 1964. He then taught philosophy and religion at Ōtani University. At various times Nishitani was a visiting professor in the United States and Europe. According to [[James Heisig]], after being banned from holding any public position by the [[Occupied Japan|United States Occupation authorities]] in July 1946, Nishitani refrained from drawing "practical social conscience into philosophical and religious ideas, preferring to think about the insight of the individual rather than the reform of the social order."James W. Heisig. ''Philosophers of Nothingness''. Honolulu: University of Hawai'i Press, 2001. In James Heisig's ''Philosophers of Nothingness'' Nishitani is quoted as saying "The fundamental problem of my life … has always been, to put it simply, the overcoming of nihilism ''through'' nihilism."{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/53344327|title=Philosophers of nothingness : an essay on the Kyoto school|last=1944-|first=Heisig, James W.,|date=2001|publisher=University of Hawai'i Press|isbn=058546359X|location=Honolulu|oclc=53344327}} == Thought == On Heisig's reading, Nishitani's philosophy had a distinctive religious and subjective bent, drawing Nishitani close to existentialists and mystics, most notably [[Søren Kierkegaard]] and [[Meister Eckhart]], rather than to the scholars and theologians who aimed at systematic elaborations of thought. Heisig further argues that Nishitani, "the stylistic superior of Nishida," brought Zen poetry, religion, literature, and philosophy organically together in his work to help lay the difficult foundations for a breaking free of the Japanese language, in a similar way to [[Blaise Pascal]] or [[Friedrich Nietzsche]]. Furthermore, Heisig argues that, unlike Nishida, who had supposedly focused on building a philosophical system and who, towards the end of his career, began to focus on [[political philosophy]], Nishitani focused on delineating a standpoint "from which he could enlighten a broader range of topics," and wrote more on [[Buddhist]] themes towards the end of his career. In works such as ''Religion and Nothingness'' Nishitani focuses on the Buddhist term [[sunyata]] (emptiness/nothingness) and its relation to Western nihilism.[http://www.japantimes.co.jp/culture/2016/04/30/books/black-illumination-abyss-keiji-nishitani/#.V2wx37RRfdk "The abyss of Keiji Nishitani"] by Eugene Thacker, Japan Times, 30 Apr. 2016. To contrast with the Western idea of nihility as the absence of meaning Nishitani; sunyata relates to the acceptance of [[anatta]], one of the three [[Noble Eightfold Path|Right Understandings]] in the Noble Eight fold Path and the rejection of the ego in order to recognize the [[Pratītyasamutpāda]], to be one with everything. Stating: "All things that are in the world are linked together, one way or the other. Not a single thing comes into being without some relationship to every other thing."{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/7464711|title=Religion and nothingness|last=1900-1990.|first=Nishitani, Keiji,|date=1982|publisher=University of California Press|isbn=0520043294|edition= 1st paperback |location=Berkeley|oclc=7464711}} However, Nishitani always wrote and understood himself as a ''philosopher'' akin in spirit to Nishida insofar as the teacher—always bent upon fundamental problems of ordinary life—sought to revive a path of life walked already by ancient predecessors, most notably in the Zen tradition. Nor can Heisig's reading of Nishitani as "existentialist" convince in the face of Nishitani's critique of existentialism—a critique that walked, in its essential orientation, in the footsteps of Nishida's "Investigation of the Good" (Zen no Kenkyū). Among the many works authored by Nishitani in Japanese, are the following titles: ''Divinity and Absolute Negation'' (Kami to zettai Mu; 1948), ''Examining Aristotle'' (Arisutoteresu ronkō; 1948); ''Religion, Politics, and Culture'' (Shūkyō to seiji to bunka; 1949); ''Modern Society's Various Problems and Religion'' (Gendai shakai no shomondai to shūkyō; 1951); ''Regarding Buddhism'' (Bukkyō ni tsuite; 1982); ''Nishida Kitaro: The Man and the Thought'' (Nishida Kitarō, sono hito to shisō; 1985); ''The Standpoint of Zen'' (Zen no tachiba; 1986); ''Between Religion and Non-Religion'' (Shūkyō to hishūkyō no aida; 1996). His written works have been edited into a 26-volume collection ''Nishitani Keiji Chosakushū'' (1986-1995). A more exhaustive list of works is accessible on the Japanese version of the present wikipage. ==Partial bibliography in English translation== '''Monographs'''
Nishitani Keiji. 1982. ''[[Religion and Nothingness]]''. Translated by [[Jan Van Bragt]]. Berkeley: University of California Press. ({{ISBN|0-520-04946-2}})
Nishitani Keiji. 1990. ''The Self-Overcoming of Nihilism''. Translated by Graham Parkes and Aihara Setsuko. Albany: State University of New York Press.
Nishitani Keiji. 1991. ''Nishida Kitarō''. Translated by Yamamoto Seisaku and James W. Heisig. Berkeley: University of California Press.
Nishitani Keiji. 2006. ''On Buddhism''. Translated by Yamamoto Seisaku and Robert E. Carter. Albany: State University of New York Press.
Nishitani Keiji. 2012. ''The Philosophy of Nishitani Keiji 1900-1990 - Lectures on Religion and Modernity''. Translated by [[Jonathan Morris Augustine]] and [[Yamamoto Seisaku]]. New York: The Edwin Meller Press. ({{ISBN|0-7734-2930-1}}) '''Articles'''
Nishitani Keiji. 1960. ”The Religious Situation in Present-day Japan.” ''Contemporary Religions in Japan'', 7-24.
Nishitani Keiji. 1984. ”Standpoint of Zen.” Translated by John C. Maraldo. ''The Eastern Buddhist'' 17/1, 1–26.
Nishitani Keiji. 1989. ”Encounter with Emptiness.” In ''The Religious Philosophy of Nishitani Keiji'' (edited by Taitetsu Unno). Jain Publishing Company. 1-4.
Nishitani Keiji. 1990. "Religious-Philosophical Existence in Buddhism." Translated by Paul Shepherd. ''The Eastern Buddhist'' (New Series) 23, 1-17.
Nishitani Keiji. 2004a. ”The Awakening of Self in Buddhism.” In ''The Buddha Eye - An Anthology of the Kyoto School and Its Contemporaries'' (edited by Frederick Franck). World Wisdom: Bloomington, Indiana. 11–20.
Nishitani Keiji. 2004b. ”The I-Thou Relation in Zen Buddhism.” In ''The Buddha Eye - An Anthology of the Kyoto School and Its Contemporaries'' (edited by Frederick Franck). World Wisdom: Bloomington, Indiana. 39–53.
Nishitani Keiji. 2004c. ”Science and Zen.” In ''The Buddha Eye - An Anthology of the Kyoto School and Its Contemporaries'' (edited by Frederick Franck). World Wisdom: Bloomington, Indiana. 107–135.
Nishitani Keiji. 2008. ”My Views on ”Overcoming Modernity”." In ''Overcoming Modernity - Cultural Identity in Wartime Japan'' (translated and edited by Richard Calichman). New York: Columbia University Press. 51-63. ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== * [[James Heisig]], ''Philosophers of Nothingness'', Honolulu: University of Hawai'i Press, 2001, {{ISBN|0-8248-2481-4}} ==External links== * {{wikiquote-inline}} {{Kyoto University}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nishitani, Keiji}} [[Category:1900 births]] [[Category:1990 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century philosophers]] [[Category:Buddhism and other religions]] [[Category:Buddhist existentialists]] [[Category:Buddhist philosophers]] [[Category:Existentialists]] [[Category:Japanese Buddhists]] [[Category:Japanese philosophers]] [[Category:Japanese writers]] [[Category:Kyoto University alumni]] [[Category:Kyoto University faculty]] [[Category:Kyoto School]] [[Category:Moral philosophers]] [[Category:Ontologists]] [[Category:People in interfaith dialogue]] [[Category:Philosophers of nihilism]] [[Category:Philosophers of religion]]
